sentence: Thankfully, Democrats refused to accept this Republican healthcare  crisis and forced this vote to extend the ACA tax credits.
title: Providing for Consideration of H.R. Breaking the Gridlock Act

sentence: Congress has 3 legislative days left to extend the ACA tax credits,  or they will expire at the end of the year.
title: Providing for Consideration of H.R. Lower Health Care Premiums for All Americans Act; Providing for Consideration of H.R. Do No Harm in Medicaid Act; Providing for Consideration of H.R. sentence: Since the beginning of this year, Democrats have been trying to work  in good faith with Washington Republicans to extend these ACA enhanced  premium tax credits and protect Americans' healthcare coverage.
title: Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act, 2026

sentence: Vote to extend the ACA tax  credits and lower costs for America's families.
title: Breaking the Gridlock Act

sentence: It doesn't extend the ACA  premiums by a single day.
title: Healthcare

sentence: I urge our Senate  Republican colleagues to stop stalling and extend the ACA subsidies  immediately to lower healthcare costs for millions of Americans who are  bearing the brunt of the Republican healthcare crisis.
title: Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2026

sentence: In a matter of days, roughly 130,000 people in my home State of  Alabama will lose their healthcare coverage because Republicans in this  body refuse to extend the ACA tax credits.
title: Lower Health Care Premiums for All Americans Act

sentence: If Republicans were serious about helping their constituents and  addressing the healthcare crisis that they manufactured with the big,  ugly bill, they would join Democrats and vote to extend the ACA tax  credits for 3 years.

sentence: Let's  stop the premium hikes, extend the ACA tax credits, and get back to  building a healthcare system that is worthy of the American people.
title: Lower Health Care Premiums for All Americans Act

sentence: I am very glad that 17 of my Republican colleagues joined Democrats  today in doing the right thing by voting to extend the ACA tax credits  for 3 more years to protect access to affordable healthcare.

sentence: Speaker, I want to make sure the chairman from  Kentucky knows that a middle-class, 60-year-old couple in his district  is seeing their premium go up by $1,711 per month unless we extend the  ACA tax credits.
title: Lower Health Care Premiums for All Americans Act

sentence: What does this Republican plan do to extend the ACA  subsidies?
title: Lower Health Care Premiums for All Americans Act

sentence: We must deliver and extend the ACA tax credits because America is  counting on us to survive, to thrive, and to have another chance.

sentence: Speaker, after the 43-day Democratic-led shutdown, I  agreed to sit down with my Democratic and Republican colleagues to  negotiate in good faith to extend the ACA enhanced premium tax credit  with reforms.
title: Providing for Consideration of H.R. Breaking the Gridlock Act
